alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 2:37PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Johnson County through 315 PM MDT... At 236 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Fort Phil Kearny Historical Site to near Hole In The Wall. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lake De Smet around 240 PM MDT. Kaycee around 245 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Linch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 237 and 299. Interstate 90 between mile markers 42 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
